VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Create Metadata for Configurations Added in a Patch

Some B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9), CloudCraze 4.8, or CloudCraze 4.7 patches depend on new storefront configuration settings. If you're upgrading to one of these patches, manually create the appropriate metadata before you can set the new configuration settings.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any solution upgrading to:

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.4 or later
CloudCraze 4.8 patch 3.133.24 or later
CloudCraze 4.7 patch 3.124.36 or later


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

Complete these steps to create configuration metadata needed for certain patches, and set the appropriate values for a storefront.

NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or later, new configuration metadata is available after upgrading the managed package. If your upgrade path includes B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10), you can skip these steps.
Install the patch build in your org.
Create metadata for the Previous Cart Fetch Logic configuration in the Cart module.
NOTE Complete this step for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.4 or later. If you're using CloudCraze 4.8 or 4.7, this configuration setting doesn't apply.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select Cart (2).
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Previous Cart Fetch Logic
API Name	olctflw
Description	Use legacy cart fetch logic. Possible values: TRUE, FALSE. To take advantage of performance improvements, use FALSE. To resolve compatibility issues, set to TRUE.
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)
Create metadata for the Spec Value Query Limit configuration in the Product List module.
NOTE Complete this step for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.6 or later. If you're using CloudCraze 4.8 or 4.7, this configuration setting doesn't apply.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select Product List (2).
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Spec Value Query Limit
API Name	specvaluequerylimit
Description	The maximum number of spec value records to search when returning product data. Enter a string with no thousands operator. The default is 20000. The complexity of your product data can also affect the scope of the query, regardless of limit.
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)
Create metadata for the Default Record Owner configuration in the User Profile (Registration) module.
NOTE Complete this step for:
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.36 or later
CloudCraze 4.8 patch 3.133.24 or later
CloudCraze 4.7 patch 3.124.36 or later
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select User Profile (Registration) (2).
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Default Record Owner
API Name	groid
Description	The ID of the user who is the default owner of records that guest users create, such as carts and orders. The default owner has access to all new records that guest users create.
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)
Create metadata for the Restore Legacy jQuery HTML Prefilter configuration in the User Interface module.
NOTE Complete this step for:
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.38 or later
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select User Interface (2).
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Restore Legacy jQuery HTML Prefilter
API Name	restorelegacyhtmlprefilter
Description	Work around jQuery 3.5.0 breaking changes to HTML in subscriber code. To restore the legacy jQuery.htmlPrefilter behavior, use TRUE. To use updated jQuery.htmlPrefilter behavior, use FALSE.
Externally Safe	TRUE (enabled)
Create metadata for the Override Default Batch Size and Custom Batch Size configurations in the Product Indexing module.
NOTE Complete this step for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.39 or later. If you're using CloudCraze 4.8 or 4.7, this configuration setting doesn't apply.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select Product Indexing (2).
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Override Default Batch Size
API Name	ovrbsize
Description	Replace the default calculation for the total number of price list items (200/number of locales +1) evaluated in each Apex batch job that builds product index records. Possible values: TRUE, FALSE. When TRUE, use Batch Size to specify your own value.
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)
Repeat the previous step, but enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Custom Batch Size
API Name	bsize
Description	An integer that’s the number of products whose price list items are evaluated in each product index batch job. Ensure that the total number of price list items queried at one time is 50,000 or less. By default, this number is: 200/(number of locales + 1).
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)

After you've created the configuration metadata, set each configuration globally (the setting applies to all storefronts in your org) or set a storefront-specific value.
